item.title: Life, Liberty, and Justice for All Americans Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, Homeland Security, And Investigations.

item.title: To prohibit the use of drones to kill citizens of the United States within the United States.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, Homeland Security, And Investigations.

item.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 22.
Introduced in the Senate. Read the first time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Read the First Time.

summary.text:
Prohibits the federal government from using a drone (unmanned aircraft) to kill a U.S. citizen located in the United States.

Makes such prohibition inapplicable to an individual who poses an immediate threat of death or serious bodily injury to another.

States that nothing in this Act shall be construed to allow the killing of a U.S. citizen located in the United States without due process of law.

bill.title: A bill to prohibit the use of drones to kill citizens of the United States within the United States.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
